method.name: Generalized Editing using Nearest Neighbor

reference.ref: Koplowitz, J., Brown, T.A. On the relation of performance to editing in nearest neighbor rules (1981) Pattern Recognition, 13, pp. 251‚Äê255.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Prototype Generation. Noise Filter.
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: Initialy, resulting set is the same as training set. The algorithm picks prototypes of the training data set randomly, applies KNN rule to that prototype and the resulting set. If the majority of the neighbors have got the same class than the picked prototype, it relabels that prototype with the majority class. Else, remove the neighbors and the picked prototype of the resulting set.

parameterSpec.param: Number of neighbors: Integer value. Number of nearest prototypes considered to classify an example using the K-Nearest Neighbor Rule (k)

method.example:
Problem type: Generation Method: PG-GENN Dataset: irir Training set: iris-10-1tra.dat Parameters: default values
We can see output set in Experiment\Results\PG-GENN:
relation iris_plants_database @attribute sepalLength real[4.3,7.9] @attribute sepalWidth real[2.0,4.4] @attribute petalLength real[1.0,6.9] @attribute petalWidth real[0.1,2.5] @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class 5.1, 3.5, 1.4, 0.2, Iris-setosa 4.9, 3.0, 1.4, 0.2, Iris-setosa 4.7, 3.2, 1.3,
